And here's the current version:

@Max Maximov can we pass custom template?
Because now I see that we can pass only strings - https://upsource.jetbrains.com/youtrack/file/970f19814cb3ee915640a6d6c6bd72bc1ac4db4a/charisma/youtrack-frontend/app/pages/projects/controller/projects.js?nav=742:831:focused&preview=false

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527251028974,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2889252","author":"Maxim.Maximov","authorFullName":"Max Maximov","issueId":"JT-47358","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Maksim Ryzhikov, it's a quite hard to handle Angular stuff inside React component, so let's use React on the YouTrack side to solve this issue for now. And let's discuss it one more time to find a better decision after the release.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527273952185,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2889257","author":"maksimrv","authorFullName":"Maksim Ryzhikov","issueId":"JT-47358","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Max Maximov Ok, let's discuss it on Monday because use React inside angular also quite hard :)

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527274234185,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2889260","author":"maksimrv","authorFullName":"Maksim Ryzhikov","issueId":"JT-47358","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Max Maximov as an example of good abstraction over React you can look at our alert service.
https://upsource.jetbrains.com/youtrack/file/ba2c5f36dc2ae3d5fb565e6140bdcea388695bed/charisma/youtrack-frontend/app/components/alert/service/yt-alert.js
https://upsource.jetbrains.com/youtrack/file/ba2c5f36dc2ae3d5fb565e6140bdcea388695bed/charisma/youtrack-frontend/app/components/alert/test/service/yt-alert.js
You can do similar stuff inside the project list

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527274372412,"updated":1527274406207,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2889265","author":"Maxim.Maximov","authorFullName":"Max Maximov","issueId":"JT-47358","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Maksim Ryzhikov, how about using JSX? Something like this:

        noProjectsFound: (
          <span>
            {i18n('There are no projects yet.')}
            <span>  </span>
            <Link>{i18n('Start with creating one')}</Link>
            <span> or </span>
            <Link>{i18n('Import from Jira')}</Link>
          </span>
        ),
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527274656152,"updated":1527273952132,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2889267","author":"maksimrv","authorFullName":"Maksim Ryzhikov","issueId":"JT-47358","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Max Maximov nope, because two-way data binding doesn't work and handlers also don't work.

{"id":"JT-47151","entityId":"25-1983333","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"47151"},{"name":"summary","value":"Can't properly add an image to a comment via keyboard (Cmd/Ctrl+V)"},{"name":"description","value":"
1. Edit comment
2. Want to insert (cmd+c) an image in the comment text.
3. The image is uploading, it's said "uploaded" but it doesn't appear in the text.
4. Refresh the page, the image is attached but not in the text as it was supposed to.

!image.png!
"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1525957039671"},{"name":"updated","value":"1526585984496"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"xi-eye"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Alexander Anisimov"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"Natasha.Katson"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Natasha Katson"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"2"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"JT-47238","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"YTB-866","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Single Issue View"],"valueId":["Single Issue View"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 67","id":"YouTrack:sprint 67"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"weird_edit_issue.gif","id":"74-522978","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/weird_edit_issue.gif?file=74-522978&c=true"},{"value":"image1526575207221.png","id":"74-525651","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/image1526575207221.png?file=74-525651&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"27-2874258","author":"Andrey.Akinshin","authorFullName":"Andrey Akinshin","issueId":"JT-47151","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
I have the following problem all the time:
1. I'm making a screenshot and copy it to clipboard.
2. I'm starting a new comment and paste it via Ctrl+V.
3. I see something like !image1526574919141.png! in the comment body.
4. There are 3 possible situation with the attachment:
a) I have !image1526574919141.png! in the attachment, everything is OK.
b) I have something like !image.png! in the attachment, so my !image1526574919141.png! can't be resolved. =(
c) No attachment. =(
!image1526574981848.png!
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526575166503,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2874262","author":"Andrey.Akinshin","authorFullName":"Andrey Akinshin","issueId":"JT-47151","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
I tried to attach a screenshot to the previous comment without success. =(
